pullRequest.body:
In this file, we obtain a induction principles which allow to prove properties of (co)structured arrows for a localization functor.

(This shall be used in the formalization of derived functors.)


---

### PR summary [c8f63fdce9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14717/commits/c8f63fdce96d6347d51e2c9b324cbb68f0ca9889)

#### Import changes for modified files

|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Localization.StructuredArrow`|434|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Construction.wInv_eq_isoOfHom_inv`
`+ Construction.wIso_eq_isoOfHom`
`+ induction_costructuredArrow`
`+ induction_structuredArrow`
`+ isoOfHom_op_inv`
`+ isoOfHom_unop`
`+ structuredArrowEquiv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10022716940/job/27702793883)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10022716940/job/27702793932)
Should this be called `wInv` instead of `winv`? (out of scope of this PR ofc)
Thanks! As this is mostly unused (this is part of the very internals of the localization API which should not be used too much), I have done the renaming.
Am I correct that `induction_structuredArrow` is strictly more general? If so, maybe `private` this or indicate that this is an auxiliary lemma in the docstring.
Yes, I have made it private.

```suggestion
@[elab_as_elim]
lemma induction_structuredArrow (g : StructuredArrow (L.obj X) L) : P g := by
```
Actually, putting this attribute breaks the proof of the dual variant.

The proof of the dual variant would become
```
lemma induction_costructuredArrow (g : CostructuredArrow L (L.obj Y)) : P g := by
  let g' := StructuredArrow.mk (T := L.op) (Y := op g.left) g.hom.op
  show P (CostructuredArrow.mk g'.hom.unop)
  induction g' using induction_structuredArrow L.op W.op with
  | hP₀ => exact hP₀
  | hP₁ f φ hφ => exact hP₁ f.unop φ.unop hφ
  | hP₂ w hw φ hφ => simpa [isoOfHom_op_inv L W w hw] using hP₂ w.unop hw φ.unop hφ
```
It depends on your use case though. If the term you would like to induct on usually takes on the shape `StructuredArrow.mk _`, it is probably more useful to state these induction principles as `(P : ∀ X, (L.obj X ⟶ L.obj Y) → Prop)`.

```suggestion
@[elab_as_elim]
lemma induction_costructuredArrow (g : CostructuredArrow L (L.obj Y)) : P g := by
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Localization): induction principles for (co)structured arrows
